arm_group.description: GAD-M regimen means High dose of methotrexate combined with gemcitabine, pegaspargase and dexamethasone

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of High dose of
      Methotrexate combined with gemcitabine, pegaspargase and dexamethasone (GAD-M regimen) as
      first-line treatment in patients with de novo extranodal NK/T cell lymphoma.

clinical_study.brief_title: GAD-M Regimen As First-Line Treatment in Untreated Extranodal NK/T Cell Lymphoma

detailed_description.textblock:
Studies have shown that effects of P glycoprotein mediated chemotherapy resistance reduce
      the therapeutic efficacy of anthracycline-based chemotherapy of NK/T cell lymphoma, and
      agents like pegaspargase and large doses of Methotrexate is not affected by the P
      glycoprotein. A number of reports suggest that gemcitabine combined with other chemotherapy
      drugs has good application prospect in the treatment of lymphomas. Dexamethasone is used in
      combination with other agents for the treatment of lymphomas which may be implicated in the
      development or growth of some cancers. So we explored to evaluate the efficacy and safety of
      High dose of methotrexate combined with gemcitabine, pegaspargase and dexamethasone (GAD-M
      regimen) as first-line treatment in patients with untreated extranodal NK/T cell lymphoma.

intervention.description: Dexamethasone 20mg/d intravenous drip D1, po D2-3

facility.name: Department of Medical Oncology, Sun Yat-Sen University Cancer Center

clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Single-center, Phase II Clinical Trial for Treatment of Untreated Extranodal NK/T Cell Lymphoma With High Dose of Methotrexate in Combination With Gemcitabine, Pegaspargase and Dexamethasone (GAD-M Regimen)

other_outcome.measure: The number of participants with adverse events of grade 3-4
other_outcome.time_frame: every 3 weeks, up to completion of treatment (approximately 6 months)

other_outcome.measure: Epstein-Barr virus(EBV) DNA copies and antibodies
